intro: Synclisia delagoensis, commonly known as the Delagoense Synclisia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
